subject: Investing
title: A Brief History of Stock Markets
description: A quick, practical guide to A Brief History of Stock Markets.

hook.text: The first stock exchange opened in Amsterdam in 1602. Traders bought shares of the Dutch East India Company.

buildup.text: Merchants needed money for risky voyages. Selling shares let them spread the risk among many investors.

discovery.text: The model worked so well that London and New York built their own exchanges within 200 years.

twist.text: Early markets had no rules. Insider trading, fraud, and manipulation were completely normal.

climax.text: After the 1929 crash, the US created the SEC to regulate markets. Investor protection became law.

punchline.text: Stock markets started as a way to fund ships. Now they fund the world.

quiz.question: Where did the first stock exchange open?
